H0.text: Friction is a force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun.

H2.text: Radiation is a force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun.

H3.text: Magnetism is a force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun.

A4.text: Planets orbit the Sun in an ellipse as a consequence of the law of gravity.

A5.text: Gravity becomes the most significant interaction between objects at the scale of astronomical bodies, and it determines the motion of satellites, planets, stars, galaxies, and even light.
